job_description: LIS Business Analyst (Austin, Texas) - job post Sonic Reference Laboratory, Inc 8 reviews Austin, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Functions, Duties, Responsibilities and Position Qualifications: Overview The Business Application Analyst (BA) will be responsible for evaluating and deploying business dependent software and application solutions in a clinical laboratory environment. The BA will learn our proprietary Laboratory Information System (LIS) and champion development and improvements. The position may also require specific programming experience to support and develop bioinformatics and automation solutions. The BA will spend a significant amount of time with Research and Development in building instrument interfaces and have a moderate level of interaction with lab staff. Responsibilities Build and validate new tests in the Laboratory Information System (LIS) utilized by Sonic Reference Laboratory (SRL) Participate in the design, user testing and documentation of new or existing applications and upgrades for business needs and ensure comprehensive testing scenarios are documented Troubleshoot performance and workflow issues related to laboratory utilization of the LIS Test system upgrades and modifications to ensure seamless transition to production Provide test build details and perform roundtrip testing upon request from customers Champion new interface development between LIS and instruments Communicate prioritization of task development across SRL to centralized IT resources Assist with startup and ongoing training for LIS users Support and deploy software solution in an CAP and CLIA accredited business Liaise with Compliance and Operations to ensure systems are compliant with standards Assist with resolution of non-conforming events related to IT and the LIS Develop process improvements and technical solutions for automation Scope: Performs development and business support duties as described by management. Knowledge and communications skills necessary for the design, analysis, and implementation of software solutions; computer hardware and specific software knowledge; as well as a developing new knowledge of the laboratory information system and technical solutions are paramount to success in this position. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Clinical laboratory, hospital laboratory and/or clinical trials experience preferred but not required. Knowledge of Healthcare Information Technology and trends in technology relating to software applications In-depth, hands-on knowledge of laboratory/clinical information systems, order entry and EHR systems Experience with scripting and/or programming languages preferred but not required (Python, Perl, R etc.) Experience with Database administration and/or designing SQL queries Experience utilizing Crystal reports and/or other reporting applications Ability to perform data analysis and present findings in a concise actionable manner Ability to conduct research into software development and delivery concepts, as well as technical application issues Ability to absorb new ideas and concepts quickly Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment Must be a resourceful self-starter, flexible, pro-active, and solution-oriented Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills Ability to develop and interpret technical documentation for training and end user procedures Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Medical Technology, Biological Science Computer Science, or relevant field. Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 Work Shift: Job Category: Laboratory Operations Company: Sonic Reference Laboratory, Inc Sonic Healthcare USA is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to an inclusive workplace for all employees. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Business Analyst I - job post Silicon Labs Careers 35 reviews Austin, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time We are Silicon Labs. We are a leader in secure, intelligent wireless technology for a more connected world. Our integrated hardware and software platform, intuitive development tools, unmatched ecosystem and robust support make us the ideal long-term partner in building advanced industrial, commercial, home and life applications. We make it easy for developers to solve complex wireless challenges throughout the product lifecycle and get to market quickly with innovative solutions that transform industries, grow economies and improve lives. Our IT Business Analysts are operationally focused application software specialists who assist our internal client teams by configuring, enhancing, and supporting our enterprise software systems. They are responsible for understanding our clients’ business requirements and translating those requirements into software configuration settings and specifications to enhance the software when necessary. They test the resulting software changes, and train end users on use of the resulting software. They possess strong technical skills to work with software developers, and excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work with the clients. What You’ll Do As an IT Business Analyst for our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system, you will perform the following functions: Translate business requirements from our Sales Operations client team into software configuration settings within our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system. Translate business requirements from our Order Fulfillment client team into software configuration settings within our SAP ERP Sales & Distribution system. Create functional design specifications for code changes to our SAP systems when required. Test resulting software configuration changes and code enhancements to ensure that business requirements are met. Create training documentation and train client end users to use the updated system. Design security roles and train clients to understand what roles they need to perform their job duties. Work with our data warehousing team to ensure reporting requirements are met. Work with other software engineering teams to ensure proper flow of data across applications. Participate in upgrades of our SAP ERP system by testing to verify that key processes continue to function normally in the upgraded system. Work with SAP customer support organization to resolve technical issues in the software. Develop B2B software for Sales and Shipping processes using standard B2B formats (Rosettanet, ANSI, EDIFACT) Who You Are A Bachelor’s degree required. Preferred degrees are BS/MS/PhD in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Information Systems. Excellent interpersonal skills are required. Excellent written and oral communication skills are required. Work experience in software development is desired. Work experience in Agile software development methods is desired. Work experience with Enterprise Resource Planning systems is desired. Exposure to SAP is added advantage. Exposure to SAP Logistics execution, SAP CRM, SAP ABAP is desired. Exposure to the semiconductor industry is desired. are operationally focused application software specialists who assist our internal client teams by configuring, enhancing, and supporting our enterprise software systems. They are responsible for understanding our clients’ business requirements and translating those requirements into software configuration settings and specifications to enhance the software when necessary. They test the resulting software changes, and train end users on use of the resulting software. They possess strong technical skills to work with software developers, and excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work with the clients. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Interacts with the customers to understand the business needs and to effectively communicate the technical solutions to the customer in terms they can understand. Facilitate the various duties, including maintaining records, and participating in workgroups and conference calls while being responsible for training and development. 25%.
